info.name: 8 ballin'
info.attribution:
Implementation, layout, library image, and all assets were designed and created by Mitchell Stolycia and are released to the Public Domain under CC BY 4.0.

The offer mechanism was originally created by Andy Pymont for the Delicious Deliveries module. The mechanism has been appropriately adapted to work with this game.
info.description:
The pool table at your favourite club has lost all of the striped balls, but you'll still have a quick game anyway.

Players compete in area majorities in order to pot balls, while sneakily stealing the money of other patrons waiting for the table.
info.similarAwards:
2009 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2005 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Advanced Game Nominee
info.helpText:
No action cards and no two-coloured disc tokens are used in this game.

The board
The board is split into eight areas in which players will compete for area majority. These are separated by the torn cloth, the pool cue, the person's arm, and the break line. The areas are also numbered by the pool balls.

Offers:
Click the Prepare Offers button to hide all players' bidding coins from each other. You can click on your offers area (the circles) above your seat to change your offer. When you submit an offer your ready marker next to your seat will be updated to show you are ready. You can toggle it back by clicking on it if you need to rethink your offer.

Submit offers of a number value equal to the number of cards you would like to offer of the matching coin type. If you wish to play a trading card with your offer, include an asterisk (*) as well as your offer amount.
For example, if the current coin token on offer is a small gold 5, and you wish to offer 3 gold coin cards and a trading card, you would submit 3* as your offer.
Due to this method of preparing and revealing offers, the trader cards themselves are not necessary for play, but are still dealt to each player as a visual reminder.

Once all players have their offers prepared, the active player can click Reveal Offers to reveal all offers. The active player can then choose which offers to accept. All accepted offers and additional card costs from the active should be paid in cards from players' Card hand to the Discard.

Any points scored throughout the game should be added to players' score trackers above their seats.

Passing:
If the active player chooses to pass on their turn, that player clicks Pass. This will automatically deal the active player two cards, everyone else one card, and end the active player's turn.

End turn:
To end your turn after offers have been made, click End turn. This will automatically deal everyone one card, and end the active player's turn.
